metadata.title: CVE-2019-7635 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) through 1.2.15 and 2.x through 2.0.9 has a heap-based buffer over-read in Blit1to4 in video/SDL_blit_1.c. USN-4143-1 addressed serveral vulnerabilities in SDL 2.0. This update provides the corresponding fixes for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-7635` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl1.2debian - 1.2.15+dfsg2-5
No subscription required

libsdl2-2.0-0 - 2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.5+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl1.2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.15+dfsg2-5').
libsdl2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1').
libsdl2-image package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.5+dfsg1-1').
sdl-image1.2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-11').
